Detailed Description

A radio button is a two-states button that can be either checked or unchecked.

When the radio button is unchecked, the user can press or click it to check it. However, contrary to a CheckBox, a radio button cannot be unchecked by the user once checked.

Radio buttons are normally used together in a RadioGroup. When several radio buttons live inside a radio group, checking one radio button unchecks all the others.

The following example demonstrates how to use the RadioButton

 gaia::ui::RadioButton* mpRadioButton = new gaia::ui::RadioButton(static_cast<Page*>(this));

 // set RadioButton text
 mpRadioButton->setText("Hello"));
See also:
RadioGroup

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::ui::RadioButton::toggle ( )

Change the checked state of the widget to the inverse of its current state.

If the radio button is already checked, this method will not toggle the radio button.

Reimplemented from gaia::ui::CompoundButton.
